Australia: The opening of the Sydney–Melbourne railway.
Silver was discovered at Broken Hill
Brazil: Mossoró, in the state of Rio Grande do Norte, is the first city in Brazil to abolish slavery.
Chile: The Treaty of Ancón is signed with Perú to end the war, but hostilities with Bolivia continue. Law of Civil Matrimony adopted. This secularization was fiercely resisted by the Roman Catholic Church. The "Pacification of Araucanía" ends, and according to some historians this concludes the long-running War of Arauco.
Haiti: Haitian poet Oswald Durand composes his most famous work, Choucoune
Indinesia: Mount Krakatoa in Sunda Strait erupted, killed 36,417 people.
Malta: The Malta Railway service is inaugurated, with service from Valletta to Floriana, Ħamrun, Msida, Birkirkara, Lija, San Antonio, Attard, Mosta (San Salvatore), and Mdina.
Peru: War of the Pacific: Under the Treaty of Ancón, the war ended with the cession of Peru's Tarapacá Province to Chile.
Philippine: Emilio Molíns becomes acting Governor-General (1883). (First Term)
USA: Buffalo Bill Cody debuts his Wild West Show.
A decision in the Civil Rights Cases legalizes the doctrine of racial segregation.
The Pendleton Civil Service Reform Act is passed.
Vietnam: Emperor Tự Đức (1847–1883) ended his rule of Vietnam.
